name: Georgia
description: Georgia, nestled in the Caucasus Mountains, is a nation of dramatic landscapes, ancient history, and vibrant culture. Known as the ‘Land of Wine’ and the ‘Birthplace of Wine,’ it boasts a unique blend of Eastern European and Asian influences. From the towering peaks of the Greater Caucasus to the fertile valleys of the Rioni and Kura rivers, Georgia offers a diverse range of experiences for travelers and nature enthusiasts alike.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, a historic crossroads of cultures.
quickFacts.detail: Tbilisi is renowned for its sulfur baths, ancient fortresses, and vibrant nightlife.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A nation of resilient and hospitable people.
quickFacts.detail: The population is predominantly Georgian, with significant minority groups including Armenians and Russians.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A land of varied terrain and stunning vistas.
quickFacts.detail: Georgia’s landscape is dominated by the Caucasus Mountains, covering approximately 70% of the country.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Georgian is a Kartvelian language, unrelated to most other European languages.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but generally around 2.7 GEL per 1 USD.

climateData.title: Climate of Georgia
climateData.description: Georgia experiences a diverse climate due to its varied topography. The coastal regions enjoy a humid subtropical climate, while the mountainous areas have a cool, alpine climate.  Summers are warm and sunny, particularly in the valleys, while winters are cold and snowy in the highlands.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A time of rebirth and blossoming, with wildflowers carpeting the hillsides.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny days, ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spectacular fall foliage and harvest season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cold and snowy conditions, particularly in the mountains.

naturalWonders.name: Svaneti
naturalWonders.description: Svaneti is a remote and breathtaking region in northwestern Georgia, renowned for its towering peaks, medieval stone towers, and unique Svan culture. It’s a hiker’s paradise and a window into Georgia’s ancient past.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The region is characterized by its dramatic alpine scenery, including Mount Shkhara, Georgia’s highest peak. The iconic Svan towers, built for defense and family protection, dot the landscape, offering a glimpse into the region’s history.  Traditional Svan cuisine and hospitality are integral to the experience.

naturalWonders.name: Borjomi-Kharagauli National Park
naturalWonders.description: A vast national park in the Lesser Caucasus Mountains, famous for its mineral springs and diverse flora and fauna. It’s a haven for hikers and nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a significant portion of the Lesser Caucasus Mountains, offering a diverse range of landscapes, from alpine meadows to dense forests. Borjomi is renowned for its mineral water, which is bottled and exported worldwide. The park is home to a variety of wildlife, including brown bears, wolves, and lynx.

naturalWonders.name: Tskhlaredi Cave
naturalWonders.description: One of the longest and most beautiful cave systems in Georgia, featuring stunning stalactites and stalagmites.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the Satskhunato mountain range, Tskhlaredi Cave is a complex network of chambers and passages adorned with impressive speleothems (stalactites and stalagmites). The cave’s formations are a testament to millions of years of geological processes.  It’s a relatively accessible cave system, making it popular with tourists.

notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of the Georgian wilderness.

ecosystemData.title: Caucasian Mixed Forests Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: The Caucasian Mixed Forests ecosystem covers a significant portion of Georgia, characterized by a mosaic of coniferous and deciduous forests, alpine meadows, and wetlands. It’s a vital habitat for a wide range of plant and animal species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Highland Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Dominate the mountainous regions, providing habitat for numerous species.

statistics.details: Approximately 30% of Georgia’s land area is covered by forests.

biodiversityCategories.name: Riverine Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Georgia’s rivers and wetlands support diverse aquatic life and provide essential ecosystem services.

statistics.details: Georgia has an extensive network of rivers and streams.
